enigma

Class Enigma

  • Object
    • Enigma
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExampleEnigma, WehrmachtEnigma

    public class Enigma
extends Object
    Replicates the encipherment of the Enigma machine.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Enigma(Rotor[] rotors, char[] startPositions)
      Sets up an enigma machine with just rotors.
      Enigma(Rotor[] rotors, char[] startPositions, Plugboard plugboard, Reflector reflector)
      Sets up an enigma machine with rotors, a plugboard and a reflector.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      String execute(String input)
      Encryption and decryption are performed in the same way in the Enigma.
      static void main(String[] args)

      • Methods inherited from class Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enigma

        public Enigma(Rotor[] rotors,
              char[] startPositions,
              Plugboard plugboard,
              Reflector reflector)
        Sets up an enigma machine with rotors, a plugboard and a reflector.
        Parameters:
        rotors - The set of rotors to be used in the order they should be used.
        rotorPositions - The starting positions of the rotors. This should be the same length as the rotors array and each char is the char that the rotor in that position should be set to.
        plugboardCables - This should be an array of the length of the alphabet, which lists pairings. It is vital that both ends of a cable are attached - that is, if the first element is 'D' then the 4th element must be 'A' so that A and D are swapped.
        reflector - The reflector object to use.

      • Enigma

        public Enigma(Rotor[] rotors,
              char[] startPositions)
        Sets up an enigma machine with just rotors.
        Parameters:
        rotors - The set of rotors to be used in the order they should be used.
        rotorPositions - The starting positions of the rotors. This should be the same length as the rotors array and each char is the char that the rotor in that position should be set to.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(Rotor[] rotors,
                      char[] startPositions,
                      Plugboard plugboard,
                      Reflector reflector)
        Reconfigure this enigma machine with the given set of components.
        Parameters:
        rotors - The set of rotors to be used in the order they should be used.
        rotorPositions - The starting positions of the rotors. This should be the same length as the rotors array and each char is the char that the rotor in that position should be set to.
        plugboardCables - This should be an array of the length of the alphabet, which lists pairings. It is vital that both ends of a cable are attached - that is, if the first element is 'D' then the 4th element must be 'A' so that A and D are swapped.
        reflector - The reflector object to use.

      • execute

        public String execute(String input)
        Encryption and decryption are performed in the same way in the Enigma. This method should be used for both.

      • rotateRotors

        public void rotateRotors(int charPos)
        Rotate scramblers one position.

      • setRotorPositions

        public void setRotorPositions(char[] positions)
        Set the position of the rotors.

        public static void main(String[] args)
